column1: Great beasts were used to pull the battering ram Grond (battering ram) during the Siege of Gondor.
Whether these beasts of burden used by Sauron were a foul breed
column3: or a race of unknown animals from distant lands
column4: is impossible to say for certain as we lack a more detailed description of the creatures.

2003: The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King:

:The great beasts are depicted as rhinoceros-like creatures. In the Weta Workshop The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King (extended edition) it is revealed they are based off of Wikipedia:Megacerops in appearance.
2006: The Lord of the Rings: The Battle for Middle-earth II:
:In this video game the basic design of the great beasts from Peter Jacksons The Lord of the Rings is kept. However
column2: a new idea is introduced: the creatures called "great beasts" were originally used by Dwarves in the Misty Mountains as underground draft animals (depicted as being much smaller than Saurons beasts of burden).
